subdialogue_text: Oh, hello. How do you do.

I am Anri of Astora.
Unkindled, like you.

I'm Anri of Astora.
Unkindled, like you.
This is Horace. A friend and travelling companion.
Are you too in search of the Lords of Cinder?

We are well along the road of sacrifices.
Below us is the Crucifixion Woods.

Beyond the flooded woods lies Farron Keep,
home of the Undead Legion.
Further yet is the Cathedral of the Deep.

We seek the cathedral,
home of the grim Aldrich.

We seek the cathedral,
home of the grim Aldrich.

We may go our separate ways now,
but we are both seekers of lords.

The next time we cross paths,
one may find the other in a time of need.
May the flames guide your way.
Oh, yes, Horace...
He's not very talkative.

But don't think ill of him. He's an upstanding,
kind-hearted knight, a fine partner for this gruelling journey.

But don't think ill of him. He is an upstanding,
kind-hearted knight, a fine partner for this gruelling journey.
Without his help, I would have cursed this onerous duty long ago.

We are well along the road of sacrifices.
Below us is the Crucifixion Woods.

Beyond the flooded woods lies Farron Keep,
home of the Undead Legion.
Further yet is the Cathedral of the Deep.

We may go our separate ways now,
but we are both seekers of lords.

The next time we cross paths,
one may find the other in a time of need.
May the flames guide your way.
Oh, and we meet again.
We spoke before on the road of sacrifices. Anri of Astora.
I am well pleased to see you safe.
I am well pleased to see you safe.

We reached the Cathedral of the Deep,
but Aldrich's coffin was empty.
The man-eater must have left for his true home.
The little doll in the empty coffin told me.

Aldrich is said to hail from Irithyll in the Boreal Valley,
an ancient fabled city...

A pilgrim told me that the city
lies beyond Farron Keep.
And so becomes our destination...

Aldrich's honest home is Irithyll in the Boreal Valley,
an ancient fabled city...

A pilgrim told me that the city
lies beyond Farron Keep.
And so becomes our destination...
Oh, hello, how very fortunate.
Have you seen my companion, Horace?
To my shame, I was snared by a trap, and we've become separated.
I've not been able to find him since.
Yes, I see.
Horace is a valiant knight. He can look after himself, no question.
He's probably searching for me right now, with twice the resolve.
If you happen upon him, please tell him.
That I remain in the catacombs...
And will lay prism stones to guide him, as always.
Please send him my word, I beg of you.
Please send him word, I beg of you.
May the flames guide your way.
If you happen upon Horace, please tell him.
That I remain in the catacombs...
And will lay prism stones to guide him, as always.
Please send him my word, I beg of you.
Please send him word, I beg of you.
May the flames guide your way.
Ah, hello, we meet again.
Have you seen Horace anywhere?

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after choosing "No" to the 2nd query
subdialogue_text:
I've searched high and low, with no luck.
Perhaps he's left the catacombs.

behavior: #0Talk-2nd time after choosing "No" to the 2nd query
subdialogue_text: Oh, Horace. Where have you run off to?

behavior: #0Choose "No" to the 2nd query, or choosing "Say nothing" to the 3rd query
subdialogue_text: Oh, Horace. Where have you run off to?

behavior: #0Choose "No" to the 2nd query, or choosing "Say nothing" to the 3rd query
subdialogue_text:
Have you abandoned me?
No, what a horrible thought...

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: Goodness me.

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: To think there'd be a lake so deep within these catacombs.

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: To think there'd be a lake so deep within these catacombs.

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text:
What a relief.
I knew that Horace was alive, and wouldn't stray far.

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: Thank you. We are both in your debt.

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text:
This hardly expresses my gratitude,
but it'll have to do for now.

behavior: #0Choose "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text:
Please, take it.
And may the flames guide your way.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: I will soon head to the lake.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: Thank you. We are both in your debt.

behavior: #0Talk-After choosing "Tell of the Smouldering Lake" to the 2nd or 3rd query
subdialogue_text: May the flames guide your way.
Oh, I thought it might be you. Good to see you.
I never managed to find Horace.

But my duty must be done, even alone.
As an unkindled Lordseeker.

For the children I knew,
bless their souls.
We all have our reasons, don't we?

Please, take this.
Recompense for my foolish request.

And also a token of protection.
May the flames guide your way.

And also a token of protection.
May the flames guide your way.

Ahh, you are brave indeed. To face your duty alone.
I would do well to learn from you.
May the flames guide your way.

Horace, we've done it, we really have...
What's happened to you?
Please, stop this!
You've gone Hollow, have you?
Then I shall put you to rest.
Horace! Join me!
